attributes.action: Stop the Closure of Stockport Art Gallery & War Memorial and Allow Temporary and Community Exhibitions to Continue at the Gallery
attributes.additional_details:
We urge Stockport Council (SMBC) to reconsider proposals affecting the use of Stockport Art Gallery and War Memorial.
SMBC proposes to restrict opening times to Sat/Sun afternoons only and stop its historic use for temporary and community exhibitions.

The gallery will no longer be a place where contemporary art, local, regional or national can be displayed, which it has done since opening in 1925.

It is a unique Grade II listed building, built entirely from voluntary public subscriptions and appears to be the only one of its kind nationally.

We oppose because it will:
• severely curtail the original intended functions of the building
• remove the only provision in Stockport of quality exhibition space for local and regional artists
• impact on the local community by withdrawing the only independent focus on art in Stockport
• impact on the provincial role of Stockport in encouraging artistic endeavour and contributing to national cultural development

rejection.details: This is a matter for Stockport MBC.
